Definition: To add fractions, make the bottoms (denominators) the same, then add the tops.
Ignore the decimal point, multiply like whole numbers, then count how many digits were after the decimal.
First subtract 3 from both sides, then divide by 2 to get x by itself.
Pick x-values, plug them in to get y-values, then plot the (x, y) points.
Do what's in parentheses first, then multiplication/division, then add/subtract.
